entry.title: Amendment 16: Status of Income Tax Clarified
entry.subtitle: Status of Income Tax Clarified
entry.extraInfo: Passed by Congress July 2, 1909. Ratified February 3, 1913.
entry.notes: Article I, section 9, of the Constitution was modified by amendment 16.

section.text: The Congress shall have power to lay and collect taxes on incomes, from whatever source derived, without apportionment among the several States, and without regard to any census or enumeration.
